Name: shi jun zi
使君子
Other: shan yang shi (droppings of goats) 山羊屎

Maladies Treated: round worms: fruit, leaves and root all used, but fruit has stronger effect
middle ear infection: root used for its anti-inflammatory and antibiotic effects
hiccups: root used with anti-inflammatory properties
cough: root used with anti-inflammatory properties
Medical Function: Fruit, leaves and root can be used for improving digestion (strengthening spleen and digestion).
Roots possess anti-inflammatory and antibiotic effect and can relieve hiccups and coughing.
shi jun zi water extract can inhibit certain skin fungi.
Dosage: 3 to 9 g; or stir fry to heat up seeds. For children use one seed for every year old. Adult dosage: 10 to 15 seeds. Take on empty stomach. Chew and swallow.
Contraindications: Taking large dosage may induce hiccups, dizziness, lack of energy, nausea, even vomiting, and diarrhea. Do not take with tea; taking with tea may induce hiccups or diarrhea immediately. Symptoms subside once stopped taking herb. If toxic reaction occurs, cloves decoction can be used frequently as an antidote. According to Ben Cao Gang Mu, drinking hot tea with this herb immediately causes diarrhea.
Research: shi jun zi water extract can inhibit certain skin fungi.
Original Text:
shi jun zi, Complementary and Alternative Healing University











Complementary and Alternative Healing
        University

Pron.

si2 gwan1 zi2




        
        Other Names:

        
        別名﹕

 shan yang shi 
        (droppings of goats) 山羊屎﹐se gan zi 色干子, 
        liu qiu zi 
        留球子﹐shi jun zi 史君子﹐wu 
        leng zi 五稜子﹐dong jun zi 冬均子﹐bing 
        gan zi 病柑子。



Common Name:
英文名﹕


        Rangoon creeper Fruit



Distribution:
產地﹕

        Mainly produced in Sichuan, Guangdong, Guangxi, Yunnan provinces of 
        China.主產於中國四川﹐廣東﹐廣西﹐雲南等地。 



Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

            sweet, warm, slightly toxic.
甘，溫。有小毒。



Channels (meridians)
      entered:
 

    歸經﹕


        spleen, stomach, large intestine.

歸脾﹐胃﹐大腸經。




        Medical functions:

        藥理﹕ 

             



Actions & Indications:

    主治﹕

        
        Fruit, leaves and root can be used for getting rid of round worms and 
        for improving digestion.Fruit are better in getting rid of round 
        worms.
Roots can also be used for arresting cough, hiccups and possess 
        anti-inflammatory, antibiotic effect. It is also used in middle ear 
        infection and prolapse of rectum.
果實、葉、根: 
        驅蛔，消疳積，健脾助消化。
驅蛔蟲作用則以果實較強。

        根有解毒消炎作用。可治呃逆﹐咳嗽等。可用於中耳炎、脫肛。




    Chemical ingredients:

    化學成份﹕



Seeds contain:


種子含


C5H6O5N3K

C5H6O5N3K

君子酸鉀(C5H6O5N3K)



C10H6O10

使君子酸(C10H6O10)




        trigonelline，C7H7O2N

胡蘆巴鹼(trigonelline，C7H7O2N)




        quisqualate 0.5%
使君子氨酸 0.5%


fat 
20～24%

cane sugar, fruitose

Leave contain:


葉含


trigonelline，C7H7O2N


胡蘆巴鹼 
        
C7H7O2N


proline


脯氨酸


aspartic acid


天門冬氨酸


C5H6O5N3K
使君子酸鉀(C5H6O5N3K)


 



Dosage:
用量﹕

        3 to 9 g; or stir fry to heat up seeds. For children use one seed for 
        every year old. Adult dosage: 10 to 15 seeds. Take with empty stomach. 
        Chew and swallow. 

用量3～9克; 或取仁炒熟，兒童每歲1粒，成人10～15粒，空腹1次嚼服。



Samples 
    of formulae:處方舉例﹕

         



Modern Research:

    現代研究﹕

    shi jun zi water extract can inhibit certain skin fungi.
使君子水浸劑對某些皮膚真菌有抑制作用。




Toxicity & Cautions:

毒素與禁忌﹕

    Taking large dosage may induce hiccups, dizziness, lack of energy, nausea, 
    even vomiting, and diarrhea. Taking with tea may induce hiccups or diarrhea. 
    Symptoms will subside once stop taking the herb. If it result in toxic 
    reaction, cloves decoction can be used as antidote.According to
    Ben Cao 
    Gang Mu , using hot tea with this herb can cause diarrhea 
    immediately.


    大量服用能引起呃逆﹐眩暈﹐精神不振﹐噁心，甚至嘔吐﹐腹瀉。不可與茶同服，若同服亦能引起呃逆。一般停藥後即可恢復。如出現中毒反應，用丁香泡茶頻服，可以解毒。

《本草綱目》："忌飲熱茶犯之即瀉。"

Maladies Treated: wind-heat with swollen and painful red eyes, with excessive tears
Dosage: Decoction: 6 to 12 g, or make into alcohol extract. External application: smash and apply on affected parts.
Samples of Formulae: For treatment of failure of clear yang to rise, causing formation of eye opacity, tinnitus and deafness: Yi Qi Cong Ming Tang. For treating wind-dampness Bi (painful obstruction): Jiang Huo Sheng Shi Tang.
Contraindications: Use with care in cases of headache, blurry vision with blood deficient and heat or in cases of pixu (spleen deficient).
Chemical Ingredients: Leaves and fruits of Vitex rotundifolia contain: Camphene, Flavone, Pigments, Vitexicarpin, Rotundifuran, Agnuside, Artemetin, vitamin A.
Fruits of Vitex trifolia contain: casticin, α-Pinene, β-sitosterol, vitamin A.

Medical Function: increases digestive juices thus shortens the emptying time of the bowels
Dosage: For decoction: 3 to 10 g. In Powder Form: 1.5 to 3 g. The effect is deemed to be better than that of decoction.
Samples of Formulae: For stones in the urinary tract: jin qian cao (lysimachia / gold coin grass), ji nei jin (Chicken Gizzard's Stomach Lining). For children's bed wetting and adults' frequent urination: sang piao xiao (mantis egg-case), long gu (dragon bone), mo li (oyster shell).
References: [1] 張錫純《醫學衷中参西錄》

Name: quan niu hua
shan jin hua
Other: shan jin che hua 山金車花

Geography: Northern and Middle parts of Europe
Maladies Treated: Used externally only: sprains and bruises, muscle pain, arthritis pain and stimulating the immune system.
Medical Function: Helenalin, an active ingredient of Arnica, is an anti-inflammatory sesquiterpene lactone from Arnica, selectively inhibits transcription factor NF-kappaB.
Contraindications: Do not use during breast feeding or during pregnancy.
Original Text:
quan niu hua,Complementary and Alternative Healing University

shan jin hua    山金花

by: Joe Hing kwok Chu
Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕Flos Arnicae
Botanical name:
學名﹕Arnica Montana L.
Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕
            arunika
Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕ 


                Pron. in Cantonese:
粵音﹕
            saan1 gam1 faa1
Other Names:
別名﹕
        shan jin che hua 山金車花
Common Name:
英文名﹕


        leopard's bane, wolf's bane，mountain 
        tobacco ， mountain arnica
Distribution:
產地﹕
            Originally produced in northern and middle part of Europe.
            產歐洲北部和中部。
Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕
            acrid, sweet.辛，甘。
Channels (meridians) entered: 
歸經﹕
Medical functions:
藥理﹕ 
            1. Analgesic,
2. Helenalin, an active ingredient of Arnica, is an anti-inflammatory sesquiterpene lactone from Arnica, selectively inhibits transcription factor NF-kappaB.
3. Anti-oxidant
4. Anti tumor
5. Choleretic
6. Uterine stimulant

止痛作用
消炎作用
抗氧
抗瘤
利膽
刺激子宮


Actions & Indications:
主治﹕external use only: sprains and bruises, muscle 
            pain, arthritis pain and for stimulating the immune system.
            外用：治療淤血，扭傷，肌肉痛、風濕痛及刺激免疫系統。
Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕helenalin
Dosage:
用量﹕ 
Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕ 
Modern Research:
現代研究﹕ 
Toxicity & Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕
        do not use during breast feeding or during pregnancy.授乳期間或懷孕期間忌用。

        Last update: Aug 9, 2013; 12:45 a.m. LAH

Name: shan dou gen
山豆根
Biological: Sophora subprostrata Chun et T. Chen

Maladies Treated: swelling of throat due to infection
cough due to infection of lungs
hepatitis B surface antigen carriers without symptoms

warts of palms of the feet: Use shan dou gen (sophora root), ban lan gen (isatis root) 60 g each. Add water 3000 c.c. Bring to boil for 10 minutes. Cool to bath water temperature, soak feet for 30 minutes once a day. For larger warts, use moxibustion for 10 minutes each time. Treated 54 patients. Number of warts per patient ranged from 5 to 27. Healed 43 cases, ineffective in 11 cases. Healing required 3-9 doses.

hemorrhoids: use northern variety of shan dou gen (sophora root). Wash and moisten for 30 minutes. Add 500 ml of water. Boil for 30 minutes, filter, soak gauze in hot (60°C) solution and apply to hemorrhoid for 30 minutes. Treated 30 cases: all showed good inflammatory relief and analgesic effect.
leptospirosis: used with da qing ye (isatis leaf) and gan cao (licorice root)
Medical Function: used clinically to clear heat toxin causing severe sore throat. In mild cases used alone by decoction or as a rinse; for severe cases combined with xuan shen (scrophularia root), ban lan gen (isatis root), she gan (belamcanda) to increase efficacy
used alone or combined with shi gao (gypsum), huang lian (coptis), sheng ma (black cohosh), mu dan pi (tree peony bark) for relieving swelling and pain of gums; used as mouth rinse
Beneficial for viral hepatitis cases where no symptoms are present but hepatitis B surface antigen carrier state exists
Dosage: For internal use (decoction): 6–10 g each day. For external application: use an appropriate amount.
Contraindications: This herb is very cold and very bitter. It can cause over-excitement of the vegetative nervous system. Overdose can lead to digestive disorders such as nausea, vomiting, poor appetite, stomachache, diarrhea, tightness in the chest area, and palpitation. Use with caution in conditions of pixu (spleen deficiency).
Research: In a lab test on rats, shan dou gen demonstrated the ability to lower AST, total protein, albumin, and cholesterol.[5]
Chemical Ingredients: alkaloids including sophocarpine, matrine, oxymatrine, anagyrine (methylcytisine), (-)-cytisine, dauricine, (+)-sophoramine N-oxide, (+)-sophoranol, dauraicoline
flavonoids including sophoranone, sophoradin, sophoranochromene, sophoradochromene, genistein
other ingredients: pterocarpine, maackian, trifolirhizin, phytosterols, higher alcohol ester of caffeic acid
References: [1] 姜忠義，中藥通報1982；7 (5):29 Jiang Zhong-YI, Chinese Medical Journal 1982;7 (5):29
[2] 窦金辉等，中國中藥雜志，1989; 14(5):40. Dou Jin-Hui, Chinese Medical Magazine, 1989;14(5):40.
[3] 江蘇新醫學院；中药大辭典，上海，上海科學技術出版社；1991；182 Chinese Medicine Dictionary by Jiangsu New Medical School, Shanghai. Published by Shanghai Science and Technology Publication. 1991;182
[4] 方立瓊，上海醫科大學學報；1992；19 (2); 124。 Fang L.Q. et al. Journal of Shanghai Medical University 1992;19(2);124
[5] 中國中醫基礎醫藥雜誌; 2005年，第11卷，第12期. Chinese Journal of Basic Medicine of Traditional Chinese Medicine; 2005, Vol 11, No.12
Original Text: shan dou gen, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University  Home 現代中藥辭典Search this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　　    　      　　    　　　　　                                                       shan dou gen 山豆根by: Joe Hing kwok ChuPharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕Rhizoma Sophorae subprostratae   Radix Sophorae subprostratae Latin botanical  name:拉丁生物學名﹕Sophora subprostrata Chun et T. ChenSophora tonkinensis GapnepEuchresta japonica  Benth.Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕sanzukonPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕santugunPron. in Cantonese::粵音﹕saan1 dau6 gan1Other Names:別名﹕guang dou gen 廣豆根Common Name:英文名﹕sophora rootDistribution:產地﹕mainly in Guangxi, Guangdong, Jiangxi, Guizhou provinces of China.主產於中國廣西，廣東，江西，貴州等省。Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕bitter, cold, toxic.苦，寒，有毒。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕lung, stomach.肺，胃。Medical functions:藥理﹕  Clinical application：:臨床應用﹕For treatment of: Swelling of throat due to infection. For mild cases, use decoction of this herb to rinse the mouth. In more serious cases add xuan shem, ban lan gen, she gan to enhance the efficacy. Swelling of gum: Cough due to infection of lungs. Hepatitis due to viral infection. Hepatitis B surface Antigent carriers but do not have symptoms Arrhythmia Cervical erosion Warts of palms of the feet: use shan dou gen,ban lan gen 60 g each. Add water 3000 c.c. Bring to boil for 10 minutes. Cool to bath water temperature. Soak feet for 30 minutes, once a day. For larger once use moxibustion for 10 minutes each time. Treated 54 patients. The smallest amount of warts on the feet is 8 and largest number is 27. Healed: 43. Ineffective: 11. The healed patients used 3 to 9 doses.【13】 Hemorrhoids: Cancer of the bladder Acute tonsillitis Small childrenpsoriasis Psoriasis For use as anesthesia in surgeries. 治病毒性肝炎 【1】： 用於熱毒蘊結，咽喉腫痛。 輕者可單用本品，水煎服或含嗽；重者須配玄 參，板藍根，射 干等藥，以增強療效。 用於牙齦腫痛。 可單用煎湯嗽口，或與石膏，黃連，升麻，牡丹皮等同用。 肺熱咳嗽: 癰腫瘡毒等症。 子宮頸糜爛 治脚底疣：用山豆根，板藍根 各60克。加水3公升。煮沸30分鐘。待稍凉時泡脚半小時。每日一次。對較大的疣體，加艾灸，每次10分鐘。共治療54例。（脚底疣數最少5個。最多27個）。治愈43例。無效11例。治愈病例用藥3～9剤。【13】   用於鉤端螺旋體病 早期肺癌，喉癌， 治痔瘡：取北山豆根洗净濕潤30分鐘。加水500毫升。煮沸30分鐘。過滤。用纱布浸滤液，趁熱（60 度）敷在痔處。保持30分鐘。治30例。均受到良好消炎止痛效果。【15】 治膀胱癌腫： 治急性扁桃腺炎:    近年用於鉤端螺旋體病及早期肺癌，喉癌，膀胱癌等，均有一定的療效。    用治鉤端螺旋體病多與大青葉，甘草合用；    用治癌症，常與白花蛇舌草，魚腥草配伍。    治 銀痟病   Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕Contains Alkaloids, as: 【1, 2】含生 物鹼如：【1, 2】sophocarpine搜果鹼matrine苦參鹼oxymatrine氧化苦參鹼anagyrine臭豆鹼(methylcytisine甲基金雀花鹼(-)-cytisine金雀花鹼dauricine山豆根鹼(+)-sophoramine N-oxide氧化槐果鹼(+)-sophoranol槐醇dauraicoline 【4】山豆根二醇 【4】Also contains various flavonoids, as:另還含有多種黃酮 類, 如：sophoranone柔枝槐酮sophoradin柔枝槐素sophoranochromene柔枝槐酮色烯sophoradochromene柔枝槐素色烯genistein 【3】染料木素 【3】Other ingredients:其他成份：pterocarpine紫檀素maackian山槐素trifolirhizin紅車軸草根甙phytosterols甾醇higher alcohol ester of caffeic acid 【3】咖啡酸的高级脂 肪醇酯 【3】Daly Dosage:每日用量﹕For decoction: 6 - 10 g. For external application: use appropriate amount.作煎剤，内服： 6～10 克。外用：適量。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕ Modern Research:現代研究﹕in lab test on rats, it showed shan dou gen could lower AST, total protein,  albumin, and cholesterol. [5]Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕This herb is very cold and very bitter. It can cause over excitement of the vegetative nervous system. Over dose can cause disorder of the digestive system and can cause nausea, vomiting, lack of appetite, stomachache, diarrhea, tightness in chest area, and palpitation.Use with care in cases of pixu (spleen deficient)山豆根大苦大寒，能使植物神經過度興奮，過量服 用能引起胃腸功能紊亂，易引起悪心，嘔吐，纳差，腹痛，腹瀉，胸悶，心悸等副作用，故用量不宜過大。  脾虛者慎用。Chemical ingredients:【1】姜忠義，中藥通報1982；7 （5）29Jiang Zhong-YI, Chinese Medical Journal 1982；7 （5）29【2】窦金辉等，中國中藥雜志，1989; 14 (5) 40.Dou Jin-Hui, Chinese Medical Magazine, 1989; 14 (5) 40.【3】江蘇新醫學院；中药大辭典，上海，上海科學技術出版社；1991；182Chinese Medicine Dictionary by Jiangsu New Medical School, Shanghai.
